quote: No hull breaches. The only damage I could find is a crushed guidance thruster -- or what looks like one.
scene: 14   EXT. ROCK PLANET - JEM'HADAR SHIP - DAY

quote: Captain --
scene: 14   EXT. ROCK PLANET - JEM'HADAR SHIP - DAY

quote: -- I think we have an access point.
scene: 14   EXT. ROCK PLANET - JEM'HADAR SHIP - DAY

quote: So... my young friend, what do you think we're looking at?
scene: 14   EXT. ROCK PLANET - JEM'HADAR SHIP - DAY

quote: An upside down ship.
scene: 14   EXT. ROCK PLANET - JEM'HADAR SHIP - DAY

quote: An airlock... a maintenance hatch?
scene: 14   EXT. ROCK PLANET - JEM'HADAR SHIP - DAY

quote: Maybe... but this is a warship... and on a warship, you want a big access point on the belly to... land troops.
scene: 14   EXT. ROCK PLANET - JEM'HADAR SHIP - DAY

quote: There's hope for you yet, Muniz. Now, you ready to race me up that hill?
scene: 14   EXT. ROCK PLANET - JEM'HADAR SHIP - DAY

quote: Anytime you say, Jefe.
scene: 14   EXT. ROCK PLANET - JEM'HADAR SHIP - DAY

quote: You see -- that's your problem -- you're so easily distracted. Stay focused on the task at hand.
scene: 14   EXT. ROCK PLANET - JEM'HADAR SHIP - DAY

quote: Can you open it, Chief?
scene: 14   EXT. ROCK PLANET - JEM'HADAR SHIP - DAY

quote: I think so.
scene: 14   EXT. ROCK PLANET - JEM'HADAR SHIP - DAY

quote: Mister Worf -- take the point. T'Lor -- you stay put.
scene: 14   EXT. ROCK PLANET - JEM'HADAR SHIP - DAY

quote: (to Worf, pointing down the corridor) Commander.
(pointing at one of the doors) Muniz.
scene: 18   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: These men didn't die in the crash... they've been dead for hours.
scene: 18   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: What killed them?
scene: 18   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Massive osteo-necrosis. Every bone in their bodies has been shattered.
scene: 18   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Sounds like inertial damper failure -- the ship accelerated and people were thrown into the bulkheads.
scene: 18   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: There was nobody alive when the ship hit the planet... but it still survived the impact. Whoever designed this baby knew what they were doing.
scene: 18   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: No viewscreen. No chairs.
scene: 18   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: No EPS conduits, no microfusion initiators, not even any power converters -- at least not that I can find.
scene: 18   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Then I suppose getting this ship up and running won't be easy.
scene: 18   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: I can't even determine what kind of warp drive it has.
scene: 18   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: I wonder if this is what all Jem'Hadar ships are like?
scene: 18   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: The bigger question is -- what's a Jem'Hadar ship doing all the way out here? We're at least three weeks from the nearest Dominion outpost.
scene: 18   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Twenty-nine other bodies -- no survivors.
scene: 18   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Can we use the runabout's tractor beam to haul this thing into orbit?
scene: 18   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: This is the greatest intelligence find in the last ten years. We're not going to leave it here to rust. What do you say, Chief?
scene: 18   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: We're not going to haul it out with a runabout.
scene: 18   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Then we need something with a little more muscle.
scene: 18   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: If you're going to prosecute me -- I demand you prosecute my co- conspirator.
I am not a conspirator!
What would you call yourself, doctor?
An idiot --
I won't dispute that.
-- for asking your help in the first place!
Would someone tell me what's going on here?
Quark brought aboard a shipment of Regalian fleaspiders without an import permit.
He asked me for them!
The spiders were for you, major. I can synthesize a drug from their venom that should improve your circulation. But I didn't know I needed a permit to import them.
So what's the problem? Fill out the paperwork.

It's not that simple anymore... it seems that Quark took the opportunity to "import" illegal Regalian liquid crystals along with the fleaspiders. The crystals are a highly intoxicating and sometimes dangerous aphrodisiac.
What's love without danger?
I don't have time for this. I just spoke to Captain Sisko. They found a crashed Jem'Hadar ship in the Gamma Quadrant and they need the Defiant right away. I'll be back in about a week.
When do we leave?
I'm leaving right away -- but I'd say you have some legal problems to work out.
Gentlemen...
-- she's embedded ninety meters into the rock. But if I can shake her loose by firing the main thrusters, hauling her out'll be a lot easier.
scene: 23   EXT. ROCK PLANET - CRASH SITE - DAY

quote: But there's a problem...
scene: 23   EXT. ROCK PLANET - CRASH SITE - DAY

quote: To fire up the main thrusters, I need to calibrate the plasma injectors, but so far, I can't even grip the ion flow regulator.
scene: 23   EXT. ROCK PLANET - CRASH SITE - DAY

quote: Want to try a hyper-spanner above the matrix? It might open it up a bit.
scene: 23   EXT. ROCK PLANET - CRASH SITE - DAY

quote: Maybe we won't send you to waste extraction just yet, Muniz.
scene: 23   EXT. ROCK PLANET - CRASH SITE - DAY

quote: We buried the bodies on the other side of that ridge.
scene: 23   EXT. ROCK PLANET - CRASH SITE - DAY

quote: Their DNA readings. Forty-two Jem'Hadar. One Vorta.
scene: 23   EXT. ROCK PLANET - CRASH SITE - DAY

quote: Hoya to Captain Sisko --
scene: 23   EXT. ROCK PLANET - CRASH SITE - DAY

quote: Go ahead.
scene: 23   EXT. ROCK PLANET - CRASH SITE - DAY

quote: A Jem'Hadar warship has just dropped out of warp.
Break orbit and get out of sight --
They've locked phasers on us. Hard to port.
Shields are down! Engage w --
Inside. We don't stand a chance in the open--
scene: 29   EXT. ROCK PLANET - JEM'HADAR SHIP - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: We may not be safer in here -- the Jem'Hadar can transport through just about anything. Sisko knows Dax is right -- but what else can they do?
scene: 35   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - CORRIDOR - DAY - CONTINUOUS

quote: Why aren't they coming?
scene: 35   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - CORRIDOR - DAY - CONTINUOUS

quote: Give them time. Watch our backs, Commander. We're moving to the Command Center.
scene: 35   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - CORRIDOR - DAY - CONTINUOUS

quote: Can you walk?
scene: 35   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - CORRIDOR - DAY - CONTINUOUS

quote: Faster than you can.
scene: 35   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - CORRIDOR - DAY - CONTINUOUS

quote: Let me take a look at that.
scene: 37   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: I'm all right, Captain. I've had worse transporter burns.
scene: 37   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Where's the Medkit?
scene: 37   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: T'lor had it.
scene: 37   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: I don't need it, sir. I'll be all right.
scene: 37   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: We have to stop the bleeding --
scene: 37   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: I'll take care of it.
scene: 37   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: A transporter burn, eh? "I'll be all right, Captain." Always kissing up to the officers, aren't you Muniz?
scene: 37   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Just following your example. You're my hero.
scene: 37   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Hey!
scene: 37   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: I have to get to the wound.
scene: 37   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: But this is my best uniform. It's the only one that fits right.
scene: 37   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: How long 'til the Defiant gets here?
scene: 37   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Two and a half days.
scene: 37   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Don't worry, Jefe... I'll get you through this.
scene: 37   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: I feel better already.
scene: 37   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: We've only got one portable generator. The rest are at the base camp.
scene: 39   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Looks like you need a new bandage, Enrique.
scene: 39   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Thanks, Chief.
scene: 39   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: I'll take it from here, commander.
scene: 39   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Do me a favor, Quique? Stop bleeding before I run out of clothes.
scene: 39   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: I'll do my best.
scene: 39   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: What do you make of this, old man?
scene: 39   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: My guess... it's some kind of virtual sensory display -- the Jem'Hadar equivalent of our viewscreen.
scene: 39   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: There're only two headsets. (answering his own question) One for the Vorta, one for the Jem'Hadar First.
scene: 39   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: I guess they're the only ones that get to see what's going on outside.
scene: 39   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Captain Sisko...
scene: 39   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: My name is Kilana. I'm the Vorta in charge of the Jem'Hadar troops surrounding you. If you touch the triangular green panel on any of the control consoles, you'll be able to speak to me.
scene: 39   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: They know your name...
scene: 39   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: They always seem to be one step ahead of us.
scene: 39   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: This is Captain Sisko.
scene: 39   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Captain, I'm so happy to hear your voice. I heard there were some casualties among your crew and I feared you may have been one of them.
scene: 39   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Thank you for your concern. What do you want?
scene: 39   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: To talk. I think it would be in everyone's best interest if you and I met face-to-face and discussed the situation, like reasonable people.
scene: 39   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: I can be reasonable.
scene: 39   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: So I've heard. I'll meet you on the hull. One escort each. Agreed?
scene: 39   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Agreed.
scene: 39   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Your photograph doesn't do you justice. You're quite striking in person.
scene: 47   EXT. ROCK PLANET - JEM'HADAR SHIP - DAY

quote: Look, I'm a little busy... so let's skip the flattery.
scene: 47   EXT. ROCK PLANET - JEM'HADAR SHIP - DAY

quote: Weyoun's report on you was right. You are direct. I like that.
scene: 47   EXT. ROCK PLANET - JEM'HADAR SHIP - DAY

quote: So let me "cut to the chase" -- I believe that is the correct expression. This is our ship. We want it back.
scene: 47   EXT. ROCK PLANET - JEM'HADAR SHIP - DAY

quote: It was your ship. Now it's mine.
scene: 47   EXT. ROCK PLANET - JEM'HADAR SHIP - DAY

quote: Captain, I'm a little disappointed. That's the attitude of a thief -- not a Starfleet captain with a reputation for integrity. This is clearly our property. What gives you any claim to it?
scene: 47   EXT. ROCK PLANET - JEM'HADAR SHIP - DAY

quote: A very old legal tradition... salvage rights. We found a wrecked ship with a dead crew. And we found it first.
scene: 47   EXT. ROCK PLANET - JEM'HADAR SHIP - DAY

quote: A very interesting position... But I'm afraid the Dominion doesn't recognize that... tradition. (and then almost an afterthought) And what may be even more to the point -- we've got you completely surrounded and outnumbered...
scene: 47   EXT. ROCK PLANET - JEM'HADAR SHIP - DAY

quote: Would you like something to eat, Captain? Or maybe something to drink? This planet is so unpleasantly hot.
scene: 47   EXT. ROCK PLANET - JEM'HADAR SHIP - DAY

quote: These are Q'lavas -- a personal favorite.
scene: 49   EXT. ROCK PLANET - JEM'HADAR SHIP - DAY - CONTINUOUS

quote: It's not poisonous, if that's what you're thinking.
scene: 49   EXT. ROCK PLANET - JEM'HADAR SHIP - DAY - CONTINUOUS

quote: Not to you, anyway.
scene: 49   EXT. ROCK PLANET - JEM'HADAR SHIP - DAY - CONTINUOUS

quote: I hope you're not teaching Jake to be this suspicious, Benjamin. Or do you prefer Ben?
scene: 49   EXT. ROCK PLANET - JEM'HADAR SHIP - DAY - CONTINUOUS

quote: "Captain" will be fine.
scene: 49   EXT. ROCK PLANET - JEM'HADAR SHIP - DAY - CONTINUOUS

quote: I'm sure it's my fault that we seem unable to establish an understanding between us, Captain. I'm sorry I'm not more experienced in these matters. This is my first mission outside the Dominion and my very first dealing with anybody from the Federation... I know you have no reason to trust me, but I hope you'll at least try to consider my offer with an open mind.
scene: 49   EXT. ROCK PLANET - JEM'HADAR SHIP - DAY - CONTINUOUS

quote: I'm listening.
scene: 49   EXT. ROCK PLANET - JEM'HADAR SHIP - DAY - CONTINUOUS

quote: If you'll leave our ship, I'll take you and your crew back to your space station -- unharmed. Our accommodations may not be lavish, but I promise you'll all be well cared for... especially your wounded. Now, that doesn't sound so bad, does it?
scene: 49   EXT. ROCK PLANET - JEM'HADAR SHIP - DAY - CONTINUOUS

quote: If you think I'm going to deliver my people into your hands without a fight -- then this really must be your first mission.
scene: 49   EXT. ROCK PLANET - JEM'HADAR SHIP - DAY - CONTINUOUS

quote: I'd love to know how the Captain's doing. Any chance of getting this working?
scene: 50   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Not right away. I'm still trying to get the main power grid on-line
scene: 50   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: What was that?
scene: 50   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: That wasn't here before.
You sure?
Positive.
Some kind of sensor device.
Whatever it is, it doesn't look friendly.
Captain -- they're in the ship!
scene: 52   EXT. ROCK PLANET - JEM'HADAR SHIP - HULL - DAY (OPTICAL)
location: ROCK PLANET - JEM'HADAR SHIP - HULL - DAY

quote: I knew it. You've been goldbricking all along.
Like I said, you taught me everything I know.
Whatever this sensor was supposed to do -- it did it and then shut down.
scene: 55   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Probably a surveillance device to find out how many of us there are... how many weapons...
scene: 55   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: I don't think so. They seem to know all that already.
scene: 55   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: It doesn't make sense. If he'd been carrying a rifle, O'Brien and I would be dead. But all he had was a knife.
scene: 55   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: And why send only one Jem'Hadar?
scene: 55   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: There's something about this ship... something so important they won't risk destroying it in a full-on assault.
scene: 55   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: If that's true, we need to find out what it is.
scene: 55   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: The first thing we need to do is make a structural scan of the ship... make our own blueprints.
scene: 55   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Get started.
scene: 55   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: It would be most efficient if we each began at opposite ends of the ship and met back in the middle.
scene: 55   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: I'll count the minutes we're apart.
scene: 55   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: I'm leaking like a ruptured plasma conduit aren't I, sir?
scene: 55   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: It's not so bad.
scene: 55   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: You're lying.
scene: 55   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: What makes you say that?
scene: 55   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Let's get one thing straight, Quique. You're not dying unless I say you're dying. And I say you're going to make it.
scene: 55   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: How are you doing, Muniz?
scene: 55   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: (re: O'Brien and himself) We seem to be having a difference of opinion on that one, sir. But I do want to file a complaint.
scene: 55   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: The nurses around here are all thumbs.
scene: 55   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Watch it there, Quique. Or I'll tighten this bandage like a tourniquet.
scene: 55   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: And as for bedside manner -- I've known nicer voles. Certainly prettier ones...
scene: 55   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: If you keep moving you won't need any nursing.
scene: 55   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Listen to the Chief, Muniz. Save your strength.
scene: 55   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: I'm worried about him, Captain. I can't stop the bleeding.
scene: 55   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Maybe it's a side effect of the Jem'Hadar weapons... they must leave some kind of anti-coagulant.
scene: 55   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: We need to get him to a medical bay or he's not going to make it.
scene: 55   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: None of us is going to make it if we don't get this ship operational.
scene: 55   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: I need the power grid functioning and the aft turret weapon on-line. You're the only one who can do that. I'll take care of Muniz...
scene: 55   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: But Captain --
scene: 55   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: You have your orders, Chief.
scene: 55   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Structurally, a lot about this ship's design matches the other Jem'Hadar warships we've seen.
But there are some significant differences. There are many systems we are completely unfamiliar with.
I can start to restore power to the systems one at a time -- that'll give us a chance to test them and establish their functions. But that's going to take a while.
How long?
I wish I knew.
You'll do it, Chief. I don't think anyone's invented a ship yet that you can't figure out.
Muniz is strong. He'll make it.
No, he won't.
He will not see tomorrow.
Keep that to yourself. I don't want him to hear that kind of talk.
It does no good to shield him from the truth. Let him prepare for death.
The hell I will! His only hope is to keep fighting -- if he gives up, it's over.
It was over the moment he was shot by the Jem'Hadar.
You listen to me (pointing a finger in Worf's chest) that boy's life is in our hands and I won't let anybody give up on him.
Worf, what do you say we go take a look at the ion exchange matrix we found... and maybe on the way we can discuss some of the finer points of diplomacy.
It's so cold here...
scene: 60   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Easy now...
scene: 60   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Captain Sisko.
scene: 60   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Captain... you're annoyed with me. I understand. You feel betrayed. And with good reason.
scene: 60   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: But I really think we should talk.
scene: 60   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: If it will make you feel better, I'll come unarmed and without an escort. But I won't hold you to the same restrictions.
scene: 60   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: You have something to say... say it.
scene: 61   EXT. ROCK PLANET - JEM'HADAR SHIP - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: Sending the Jem'Hadar into the ship was a mistake and I apologize. I trust no one was hurt? The last thing I want to do is aggravate the rift between us...
scene: 61   EXT. ROCK PLANET - JEM'HADAR SHIP - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: But what choice did I have? Just like you have to protect the lives of your men... I have to protect our... property. But I do hope we can put that behind us and move on.
scene: 61   EXT. ROCK PLANET - JEM'HADAR SHIP - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: Move on to what?
scene: 61   EXT. ROCK PLANET - JEM'HADAR SHIP - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: I'm sure it's obvious by now that there's something on the ship we want.
scene: 61   EXT. ROCK PLANET - JEM'HADAR SHIP - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: You allow me and my men to retrieve the item, and we'll leave.
scene: 61   EXT. ROCK PLANET - JEM'HADAR SHIP - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: You can keep the ship.
scene: 61   EXT. ROCK PLANET - JEM'HADAR SHIP - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: How about this... you tell me what it is you want and I'll bring it out to you.
scene: 61   EXT. ROCK PLANET - JEM'HADAR SHIP - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: I'm afraid I can't do that.
scene: 61   EXT. ROCK PLANET - JEM'HADAR SHIP - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: You don't trust me?
scene: 61   EXT. ROCK PLANET - JEM'HADAR SHIP - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: I'd like to, Captain. But I can't -- not under these circumstances... there's simply too much at stake for us.
scene: 61   EXT. ROCK PLANET - JEM'HADAR SHIP - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: We've got a lot at stake, too. I won't risk the lives of my crew.
scene: 61   EXT. ROCK PLANET - JEM'HADAR SHIP - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: It seems we're approaching an impasse.
scene: 61   EXT. ROCK PLANET - JEM'HADAR SHIP - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: I'd say we've arrived.
scene: 61   EXT. ROCK PLANET - JEM'HADAR SHIP - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: How unfortunate. Then negotiations have ended.
scene: 61   EXT. ROCK PLANET - JEM'HADAR SHIP - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: I take it things could have gone better.
scene: 63   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: All the ship's systems are shutting down, Captain.
scene: 63   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: I need to know what's going on out there. Get me some sensor readings, Chief. Dax -- take care of Muniz.
scene: 63   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: I can't feel my legs...
scene: 63   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Don't worry, they're there.
scene: 63   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Captain -- I've managed to bypass the virtual display interface and hook up a tricorder to the ship's sensor array. Those are ultritium concussion shells they're detonating.
scene: 63   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Without shields, a direct hit will destroy us.
scene: 63   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: I don't believe they're trying to hit us. Their targeting systems can't be that ineffective. They're missing us on purpose.
scene: 63   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: They're trying to rattle us.
scene: 63   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: And we're not going to let them.
scene: 63   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: The Vorta doesn't want the ship -- she wants something aboard it.
scene: 63   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Any idea what?
scene: 63   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Could be anything. An encoding device... a guidance system...
scene: 63   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Maybe she lost an earring.
scene: 63   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Whatever it is -- it's keeping us alive. Find it.
scene: 63   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Chief -- I need that weapon.
scene: 63   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: I still have to charge the emitter array.
scene: 63   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Stay on it.
scene: 63   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: You've got your weapon, sir.
scene: 69 INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Nice work, Mister O'Brien.
scene: 69 INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: But the bad news is that the turret is stuck. It can only fire in one direction.
scene: 69 INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Well maybe we'll get lucky and the Jem'Hadar will pick that place to stand.
scene: 69 INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Easy now... there's nothing to be afraid of.
scene: 69 INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: I'm not afraid, Papa. It's beautiful... precioso.
scene: 69 INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Better than last year, don't you think?
scene: 69 INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Los cuehetes... the fireworks of the Carnival. They're terrific, aren't they?
scene: 69 INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Easy, Quique.
scene: 69 INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: The colors... like a thousand shooting stars.
scene: 69 INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: That was a good one, eh?
scene: 69 INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: That was a good one.
scene: 69 INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: I'll say one thing for the Jem'Hadar... they travel light. There's no cargo... no storage compartments... I found these data crystals in one of the computer rooms... they may have some encoded information on them... but the crystal structure seems to have been randomized.
scene: 69 INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: In other words, they're blank.
scene: 69 INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: As far as I can tell. It would help if we knew what we were looking for.
scene: 69 INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: (trying to keep his own frustration in check) But, we don't.
scene: 69 INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: What's that?
scene: 69 INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: It may have been the Vorta's computer console. I found it in one of the upper compartments, but the power grid is off-line in that section of the ship...
scene: 69 INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: So you ripped it out of the wall. Very nice. What do we do with it now? Use it as a doorstop?
scene: 69 INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: I don't care what you do with it.
scene: 69 INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Worf -- I was kidding. It was a good idea. We'll hook it up and see if we can get it working.
scene: 69 INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: You'd think they'd be tired of playing this game with us by now.
scene: 69 INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: I would like to play a different game with them. If I could just leave this prison... and meet them face-to-face on a field of battle...
scene: 69 INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Right now that doesn't sound like a bad idea.
scene: 69 INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Chief, can you take a look at that console?
scene: 69 INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: That is no way for anyone to die.
scene: 69 INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: I told you -- he's not going to die.
scene: 69 INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: It is only a matter of time.
scene: 69 INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: So we might as well kill him, right?
scene: 69 INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: If you are truly his friend, you would consider that option. It would be a more honorable death than the one he is enduring.
scene: 69 INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: I'm not some bloodthirsty Klingon looking for an excuse to murder my friend.
scene: 69 INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: That's enough.
scene: 69 INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: No, you're just another weak human, afraid to face death.
scene: 69 INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: I said, that's enough!
scene: 69 INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: You're Starfleet officers. Now start acting like it.
scene: 69 INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Tough guys... a little pressure and they buckle.
scene: 69 INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Dax! Maybe you haven't noticed, but no one's laughing.
scene: 69 INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: I know it's hot. We're filthy. Tired. And we've got ten isotons of explosives going off outside... but we're never going to get out of this if we don't pull it together and act like professionals.
scene: 69 INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Chief, I want that power grid up and running.
scene: 69 INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Aye, sir.
scene: 69 INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Worf, see if you can get that turret to rotate.
scene: 69 INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Aye, sir.
scene: 69 INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Dax, search the ship again... and again and again until you find what the Vorta wants.
scene: 69 INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Aye, sir.
scene: 69 INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: And you, Mister Muniz... ... your orders are to stay alive.
scene: 69 INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Captain's log. Supplemental. The Jem'Hadar barrage has continued on- and-off for ten hours.
scene: 75   EXT. ROCK PLANET - CRASH SITE - DAY

quote: Chief O'Brien has restored main power and helm control. If we can bring the ship's engines on-line we may be able to lift off and escape from here.
scene: 76   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: As soon as we finish calibrating those induction reactors, we can power up the main core.
scene: 76   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Good. Because unless there are any objections, I'd like to get the hell off this planet.
scene: 76   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: I'm for that.
scene: 76   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Ready, Chief.
scene: 76   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: I'd love a couple more hours to fine tune these magnetic flux couplers... but under the circumstances, I'd say now is as good a time as any.
scene: 76   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Then let's do it.
scene: 76   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Everyone brace yourselves, this is going to be a rough ride. Commence launch sequence.
scene: 76   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Ion thrusters fully charged.
scene: 76   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Ventral impellers, one quarter.
scene: 76   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Plasma compensators, on-line.
scene: 76   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Ascent thrusters to one half.
scene: 76   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Chief -- I'm getting some low frequency resonance in the main reactor housing.
scene: 76   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: That's all right, just keep compensating with the inertial dampers.
scene: 76   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Dampers are at maximum.
scene: 76   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: We need more power.
scene: 76   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Ventral jets to one half.
scene: 76   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: It's working, captain. These engines just might shake us loose.
scene: 76   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Increase power to one half.
scene: 76   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Main reactor housing destabilizing.
scene: 76   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Reactor containment fields overloading.
scene: 76   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Induction dampers disintegrating. captain -- if we don't cut power now we're going to have a core breach.
scene: 76   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Disengage thrusters. Power down all systems.
scene: 76   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: How bad?
scene: 76   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: The main power grid is completely fused and the structural integrity field has collapsed.
scene: 76   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: We'll have to wait until the Defiant gets here. She can pull us out with her tractor beam. That gives us thirty-six hours to make repairs.
scene: 76   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: You all know what to do.
scene: 76   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: I could really use your help right now, Quique. I'm surrounded with nothing but officers and you know what they're--
scene: 76   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: I promised Muniz that he was going to make it.
scene: 84   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: That's what a captain's supposed to say.
scene: 84   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: I've got to get this ship back to the station, old man. Five people have died on this mission. I want to be able to tell their families why.
scene: 84   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Ben...
scene: 84   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: It's a changeling...
scene: 84   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: It can't hold its shape. It's dying.
scene: 89   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: Then we're in trouble. This is what the Vorta's been looking for. A Founder. No wonder the Jem'Hadar wouldn't attack.
scene: 89   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: They couldn't risk killing one of their gods.
scene: 89   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY (OPTICAL)

quote: The bombing has stopped.
scene: 93   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Prepare for an assault. Have Worf man the turret--
scene: 93   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Where are your soldiers?
scene: 93   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: They're dead. They killed themselves.
scene: 93   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Why?
scene: 93   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Because they allowed a Founder to die.
scene: 93   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: You should've trusted me.
scene: 93   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: How could I? The first thing out of your mouth was a lie -- this isn't your first mission outside the Dominion, is it?
scene: 93   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: I regret saying that.. but my offer was genuine. All that mattered to me was the Founder.
scene: 93   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Then you should've told me about him.
scene: 93   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: You might've killed him or taken him hostage...
scene: 93   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: No...
scene: 93   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: All I wanted was the ship.
scene: 93   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: And I was willing to let you take it.
scene: 93   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: And so this is how it ends...
scene: 93   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: It's true. The Jem'Hadar died by their own hands.
scene: 93   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Muniz... the runabout crew... your soldiers... they'd all still be alive if we'd trusted each other.
scene: 93   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: I have no way of stopping you from taking the ship. All I ask is that you allow me to remove the Founder's remains.
scene: 93   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Of course.
scene: 93   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Do you have any gods, Captain Sisko?
scene: 93   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: There are things I believe in.
scene: 93   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Duty? Starfleet? The Federation?
scene: 93   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: Then you must be pleased with yourself. You have the ship to take back to them. I hope it was worth it.
scene: 93   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: So do I.
scene: 93   INT. JEM'HADAR SHIP - COMMAND CENTER - DAY

quote: ... we used a phase-conjugate graviton emitter in the tractor beam. That baby came out of the rock on the first try. You would've loved it, Quique...
I did not mean to interrupt.
It's all right.
You are performing Ak'voh... for your friend.
I am?

An old Klingon tradition. When a warrior dies in battle, his comrades stay with the body to keep away predators. That allows the spirit to leave the body when it is ready for the long journey to Sto'Vo'Kor.
A fine tradition.
What are you doing?
We shall both keep the predators away.
I'm sure Quique would like that.
Captain's Log, Stardate 51145.3. The Defiant has been operating out of Starbase Three-Seven-Five, conducting forays into Dominion- controlled space.
While the missions have taken a toll on my people, they remain determined to do whatever it takes to win this war.. As do I.
Here you are...
How'd you get your hands on Saurian Brandy?
In the middle of a war, no less.
It's a busy Starbase. I may be a cadet, but I'm still a Ferengi.
Lucky for us.
Excuse me, captain.
The power cell from the phaser array, sir. We used it up on the last mission.
Take a good look at this, people. It says something about this ship. DEEP SPACE NINE: "Behind the Lines" - REV. 8/21/97 - TEASER 3.
It says that we're willing to fight -- and that we'll keep on fighting until we can't fight anymore.
Yes, sir!
You don't just throw something like this away.
No, sir!
Admiral on deck!
As you were.
Ben.
Admiral.
Let's take a walk. DEEP SPACE NINE: "Behind the Lines" - REV. 8/21/97 - TEASER 3A.
What was going on in there?
Just a little ritual we fell into -- it helps the crew unwind.
They deserve it. They've done a hell of a job.
Thank you, sir.
But you didn't come here to tell me that, did you?
No, I didn't. Ever since this war began, the Dominion's been able to outmaneuver us at every turn. No matter where we send our ships, they always seem to be there waiting for us.
I've noticed that.

It's almost enough to make you think they're smarter than we are. But they're not. They've just had an edge we didn't know about until yesterday. Starfleet Intelligence located a massive sensor array hidden on the periphery of the Argolis cluster. The damn thing can monitor ship movements across five sectors.
That's how they've managed to stay one step ahead of us. DEEP SPACE NINE: "Behind the Lines" - REV. 8/21/97 - TEASER 4.
They've had an enormous tactical advantage. I want you to take it away from them.
Gladly, sir.
It's not going to be easy. The array's heavily defended.
Here's the Intelligence Report. Look it over. I want an attack plan on my desk by oh-eight hundred.
You'll have it.
There he is.
Damar's a creature of habit, all right.
After a hard day's work, he deserves his glass of kanar.
Why are the Jem'Hadar always in here, he asks himself. They don't eat, they don't drink, they don't gamble -- all they do is take up space.
Damar asks his bartender if he found a PADD he was working on the other day. He misplaced it, he wants it back.
My brother tells the truth, he hasn't seen it.

Damar doesn't like that. The PADD contained a draft copy of a secret memorandum he was working on concerning the shortage of White. Without the drug, the Jem'Hadar will run amok, killing everyone and everything in their path. If the Cardassians can't bring down the minefield and re-open the supply line from the Gamma Quadrant, they're planning to poison the last ration of White and eliminate the Jem'Hadar before it's too late. How did you get hold of Damar's PADD, anyway?
I'm good with my hands.
Here we go... they've seen him.
The missing PADD.
He thinks they stole it.
The Jem'Hadar didn't like that...
Why's he pointing at that table?
Because that's where he found it. Right were I left it.
I knew this was going to work. The Cardassians and Jem'Hadar may pretend to be allies, but they hate each other.
Ow.
I don't care what they did. You shouldn't've let the situation get out of hand.
You're reduced six ranks.
How could Damar have been so stupid as to leave such an inflammatory document lying around for anyone to find?
Your men stole it from him. DEEP SPACE NINE: "Behind the Lines" - REV. 8/21/97 - ACT ONE 9.
The Jem'Hadar are not thieves.
And Damar is not a liar.
Keep your voice down. Our men need to see that we're still allies. Smile.
Dukat.
(through his clenched smile) I'm smiling.
Gentlemen, I suggest we get everyone out of here as soon as possible.
Odo's right. Tell your men they're confined to quarters pending disciplinary hearings.
I'll do the same. DEEP SPACE NINE: "Behind the Lines" - REV. 8/21/97 - ACT ONE 10.
And keep smiling.
-- according to Intelligence, the array is capable of detecting cloaked ships as far away as two light years.
By the time the Defiant got around the Argolis Cluster, the Dominion would already know we were coming.
You'd have a dozen Jem'Hadar ships on you before you even got close.
We need to have the element of surprise on our side -- it's the only way.
What are you suggesting?
That I take the Defiant through the Argolis.
You can't take a ship through there... you'd be cut to pieces by the gravimetric shear.
That's exactly what the Dominion thinks. But if we came at them from the Argolis, they wouldn't know what hit them.
What makes you think you can get through?
Dax says she can navigate around the gravimetric distortions -- she's studied proto-star clusters, she knows what to look for.
It's a gamble. But it's one I'm willing to take.
All right. Let's give it a shot. When can you leave?
As soon as we've finished repairs on the Defiant.
Keep me posted. DEEP SPACE NINE: "Behind the Lines" - REV. 8/21/97 - ACT ONE 12.
You wanted to see me?
Well? Don't you have something to say to me? DEEP SPACE NINE: "Behind the Lines" - REV. 8/21/97 - ACT ONE 13.
You mean about what happened in Quark's? It worked better than I expected.
I knew you were behind it.
Of course you did. We discussed it at the last Resistance meeting.
And I said it was a bad idea.
Yes, you did. And then you walked out of the room as if there was nothing more to say. But Rom and Jake stayed and we discussed it. And you know what? I decided it was a good idea.
So you went ahead and did it behind my back?
Why are you taking it so personally?

How do you expect me to take it? I spend my days sitting on the Council with Dukat and Weyoun, doing what I can to make sure Bajor survives this war intact. The last thing I need is to have you running around causing mayhem. DEEP SPACE NINE: "Behind the Lines" - REV. 8/21/97 - ACT ONE 14.
Do you have any idea what would happen if Dukat found out you were behind it? It would give him all the excuse he needs to throw every Bajoran off this station.
The Federation is losing this war. We can't just sit by and do nothing.
There are limits to what we can do.
I'm beginning to think you shouldn't have agreed to sit on that Council. It's as if you've gotten so invested in making sure the station runs smoothly, you've forgotten there's a war going on.
Are you questioning my loyalties, Major?
I need you, Odo. The Resistance needs you.
Answer me. Are you questioning my loyalties?
Of course not. That's not what this is about.
Hello, Odo. It's good to see you again.
Leave us. I need to speak with Odo.
Do you?
It's all right, Nerys. I may as well hear what she has to say.
Are you sure?
You called her "Nerys."
What of it?
You used to call her "major." Using a Solid's name denotes intimacy.
You're a long way from home. Here to keep an eye on the war effort?
I'm content to leave the details of the war to the Vorta.
Then what brings you to Deep Space Nine?
You.
I was trapped here in the Alpha Quadrant when Captain Sisko mined the entrance to the wormhole. I've spent too much time among Solids. I came because I felt the need to be with one of my own.
That's ironic, considering what happened the last time we crossed paths.
You caused the death of a fellow changeling, Odo. Turning you into a Solid was the only punishment severe enough for your crime.
And now that I'm a changeling again, you come here as if nothing ever happened?
We've forgiven you.
Well I haven't forgiven you. DEEP SPACE NINE: "Behind the Lines" - REV. 8/21/97 - ACT TWO 18.
It's time to put the past behind us.
What about the present? You're waging war against my home.
This isn't your home, Odo. You belong with your own kind... as part of the Great Link.
I'm quite content here, thank you.
You say that because you don't know what you're capable of becoming. Perhaps if we spend time together, you'll begin to understand.
You wanted to see me, admiral?

I just got word. Captain Bennet's promotion came through. At my recommendation, Starfleet's putting her in charge of Seventh Tactical Wing. She's one of the best adjutants I've ever had -- a strong grasp of strategy, an ability to see the big picture.
It doesn't sound like it's going to be easy to find someone to take her place.
I already have. You.
Sir?
I've been very impressed with you these last few weeks. I think we're going to make a good team.
Thank you, sir. DEEP SPACE NINE: "Behind the Lines" - REV. 8/21/97 - ACT TWO 20.
Your assignment is effective immediately.
Immediately, sir? What about the Argolis mission?
Commander Dax will captain the Defiant.
She is up to it, isn't she?
Absolutely, sir. I guess I'd just gotten used to the idea of commanding the mission myself.
Look over these tactical reports. I want your thoughts on the Bolian operation. We'll meet here at oh- six hundred. DEEP SPACE NINE: "Behind the Lines" - REV. 8/21/97 - ACT TWO 21.
Ben. Congratulations.
-- Legate Krim will be arriving in the morning.
I'll have a security detail escort him to your office. If that's all?
Founder, you honor us with your presence.
I understand the war is going well.
Only because I've followed the plan the Founders laid out for me.
Welcome to Terok Nor. I'm glad we're finally getting a chance to meet. DEEP SPACE NINE: "Behind the Lines" - REV. 8/21/97 - ACT TWO 22.
As leaders of our respective worlds, you and I are taking our people into a future that--
What about the minefield? Why hasn't it been deactivated?
Yes, Dukat. This delay is intolerable. There are thousands of Jem'Hadar ships stranded on the other side of the wormhole, waiting to come through and join the war effort.
Maybe you haven't read the latest reports, but even without those ships, I'm still winning this war.
You're winning? I assure you, I'm intimately involved in all military decisions.
See to it that the minefield is brought down.
Of course. We've imposed our presence on you long enough.
If you need anything while you're here, please let me know. DEEP SPACE NINE: "Behind the Lines" - REV. 8/21/97 - ACT TWO 23.
Do they always compete with each other like that?
As a matter of fact they do.
And you interact with them often? How trying it must be for you.
It hasn't been easy...
If you'll excuse me, I have some work to do in my quarters.
May I walk with you?
"To become a thing, is to know a thing."
"To assume its form, is to begin to understand its existence."
You tried to teach me that when I visited our homeworld.
I remember.

I didn't understand what you meant by it at first, so when I came back to the station, I got rid of the furniture I used to have in my quarters and replaced it with these objects. I've assumed every shape in this room. I suppose if it weren't for you, I would never have known the simple pleasure one can take in spending time existing as a stone, or a branch.
I'm glad you learned something from your visit.
Your arrival was a time of great joy for the Link... and your departure, a time of great sadness. If only you'd stayed with us, Odo...
I couldn't. DEEP SPACE NINE: "Behind the Lines" - REV. 8/21/97 - ACT TWO 25.
You chose the Solids.
And I haven't regretted it.
Not even a little?
I do think about the Link from time to time...
It's there for you...
I can't...
Why? Because of Kira?
You still have feelings for her, don't you?
She doesn't share them. I'm sorry.
Aren't you going to tell me that I shouldn't waste my time with a Solid?
You love her.
I wish I didn't. DEEP SPACE NINE: "Behind the Lines" - REV. 8/21/97 - ACT TWO 26.

I'm so vulnerable to her... all she has to do is smile at me and I'm happy beyond reason... a minor disagreement between us and I'm devastated. It's absurd. Sometimes I wish I could reach inside myself and tear out my feelings for her. But I can't.
Poor Odo.
I don't want your pity.
I'm not offering pity.
What I need is some peace.
What you need is clarity. I can give you that...
Do you want me to stop... ? DEEP SPACE NINE: "Behind the Lines" - REV. 8/21/97 - ACT TWO 27.
What are you doing here, Damar? Did Dukat demote you to security detail?
What can I do for you, major?
I'm looking for Odo.
He's not here.
Do you know where he is?
Yes.
That's good. It's always good to know where your boss is.
He's in his quarters.
With the other Shape-shifter.
Jealous, major?
Try to stay out of trouble, Damar, you don't want to end up on sanitation duty.
Come in.
Odo?
Nerys...
I dropped by your office. Damar told me you were here... ... with her.
She was here. But she's gone now. DEEP SPACE NINE: "Behind the Lines" - REV. 8/21/97 - ACT THREE 30.
Are you all right? What did she want?
She didn't want anything.
Then what was she doing here?
I know how you feel about her, major, but there's no reason to be concerned.
You don't know how much I wish I could believe that. You didn't Link with her, did you?
Actually, I did.
You did? What were you thinking?
She didn't find out about the Resistance, if that's why you're worried --
It's not.
The Link isn't about exchanging information, it's about merging thought and form -- idea and sensation.
Sounds like a perfect way to manipulate someone.
She's not manipulating me. DEEP SPACE NINE: "Behind the Lines"- REV. 8/21/97 - ACT THREE 31.
Ever since the day you crossed paths, she's lied to you, tricked you, sat in judgment of you -- I don't trust her. And I don't understand how you can.
I Linked with her -- if she had some hidden motive, I would've sensed it. (trying to make her understand) She's just trying to teach me about myself -- about what I'm capable of becoming.
An Intergalactic Warlord, maybe? Because that's what she is.
Who knows -- by Linking with her I might be able to make her understand that the Federation doesn't pose a threat to her people.
Do you really believe you can convince her to call off the war?

If you could experience the Link you'd understand the effect it has on my people -- you'd realize that anything is possible. I'm only beginning to understand it myself. I still have so many questions. Now that she's here, I finally have a chance to get some answers.

Odo, this isn't the time for you to go off on some personal quest. There's too much at stake. After the war's over, do whatever you need to do.DEEP SPACE NINE: "Behind the Lines" - REV. 8/21/97 - ACT THREE 32-32A.
If you want to leave and join the Great Link, I won't try to stop you. But right now, I need you here -- focused.
Promise me you won't Link with her again, Odo, not until this is over.
All right, I won't. Now if you'll excuse me, I have to get to work. I'll see you at the Resistance meeting.
Are you two ever going to finish?
Just a few more minutes, commander.
That's "captain." It's an old naval tradition. Whoever's in command of a ship, regardless of rank, is referred to as "captain."
You mean if I had to take command, I'd be called "captain," too?
Cadet, by the time you took command, there wouldn't be anyone left to call you anything. DEEP SPACE NINE: "Behind the Lines" - REV. 8/21/97 - ACT THREE 34.
Good point.
Come to take a last look around?
Not a last look, I hope.
How are the repairs coming?
(shooting O'Brien and Nog a look) Almost done.
I wouldn't get too used to that chair, old man. When this war's over, I'm going to want my ship back.
Fine. When this war's over, I'm going on a honeymoon.
All done here, captain.
Plot a course to the Argolis Cluster and prepare to depart.
I wish you were coming with us, Benjamin.
You'll do fine.
Pardon our appearance. We're renovating.
Kanar.
Not that one. The twenty-seven.
The twenty-seven? Expensive.
I can afford it... on a gul's salary. DEEP SPACE NINE: "Behind the Lines" - REV. 8/21/97 - ACT THREE 37.
Wait a minute. You started a fight in my bar and you're getting promoted? What kind of way is that to run an army?
Dukat wasn't happy about what happened. I had to find a way to make it up to him.
I hope it was something big.
Let's just say... ... it's going to change the course of history.
As a businessman, I'm very interested in the course of history. This one's on me...
That's very kind of you, Quark.
But I can't talk about it.
Of course. I understand.
-- there's obviously a lot of bad blood between the Cardassians and the Jem'Hadar. It wouldn't take much to get them to go at each other again.
I don't know if we want to do that.
But it worked so well --
What do you think, Odo?
I'm not sure it's a good idea...
Then we'll come up with something else.
Major --
Something we can all agree on.
Who could that be?
Relax. We're just sitting here enjoying each other's company.
Right.
Come in.
Brother, are you all right?
No, I'm not all right. I just shared a bottle of Kanar with Damar. That rhymes.
You're drunk.
Of course I'm drunk. I wouldn't risk coming in here and associating myself with your little Resistance Cell if I wasn't drunk.
Maybe you should leave before someone sees you.

I've tried. I've tried my best to run my establishment under this occupation. But you know what? It's no fun. (as if he doesn't want to be overheard by anyone who might be listening in) I don't like Cardassians -- they're mean and arrogant. And I can't stand the Jem'Hadar. They're creepy. They just stand there like statues, staring at you. (shivering at the memory) I've had it. I don't want to spend the rest of my life doing business with these people. I want the Federation back. I want to sell root beer again!
All right, you've made your point. Relax. DEEP SPACE NINE: "Behind the Lines" - REV. 8/21/97 - ACT THREE 41.
How can I relax when thousands of Jem'Hadar ships are sitting on the other side of the wormhole, waiting to come through?
Don't worry about it. They're stuck there.
Not if what Damar told me is true.
What are you talking about?
He said he came up with a way to deactivate the mines. Dukat wants him to start field tests right away.
Well, are you just going to sit there, or are you going to do something about it?
Come on Quark, think. It's important. Did Damar say anything about how he was planning to deactivate the mines?
Yes. He said something about the station's defector.
A defector?
That's impossible. The only person on the station who knows anything about how the mines work is...
Me.
Defector... that doesn't sound right. Maybe he said deflector. Yeah, that's it. He's going to use the station's deflector array.
What do you think, Rom?
I'm glad it wasn't me. DEEP SPACE NINE: "Behind the Lines" - REV. 8/21/97 - ACT FOUR 43.
About the deflector array -- is there any way to use it to deactivate the mines?
No. I designed the mines to be self-replicating. The only way to keep them from replacing themselves is to isolate them in an anti-graviton beam. The deflector array can't do that.
Unless you reconfigured the field generators... -- and re-focused the emitters... Which would turn the deflector array into one big anti-graviton beam...
Why didn't you think of that when you set up the minefield?
I don't know...
He doesn't know.
Quark. How can we disable the deflector array?
All you have to do to is access the EPS feed and overload the waveguide.
Let's do it. DEEP SPACE NINE: "Behind the Lines" - REV. 8/21/.97 - ACT FOUR 44.
But there's no way to get to the EPS feed. It's in a secured conduit rigged with alarms.
Odo, can you disable those alarms?
I can take them off-line for about five minutes if I run a security diagnostic.
Will that give you enough time?
I think so.
I'll run the diagnostic as soon as I get to my office in the morning.
All right. You and I will meet here. At exactly oh-eight hundred, you'll begin the diagnostic. Any questions?
When will Rom be back at work? I have ten crates of Yamok sauce that need to be unpacked.
Has there been any news, sir?
None.
The Defiant has been gone over sixteen hours.
I know this is difficult for you, Worf...
Yes, Sir... but I sense it is more difficult for you. The Defiant is your ship.
Dax'll bring her home.
There's no way she's going to miss her own wedding.DEEP SPACE NINE: "Behind the Lines" - REV. 8/21/97 - ACT FOUR 46-47.
No. I suppose not.
As soon as I hear something, I'll let you know...
Thank you, sir. Captain, you should get some rest.
Not tonight.
And have our people always been Shape-shifters, or was there a time when we were like the Solids?
Eons ago, we were like them -- limited to one form. But we evolved.
On the homeworld, are you always in the Link, or do you sometimes take solid form? DEEP SPACE NINE: "Behind the Lines" - REV. 8/21/97 - ACT FOUR 48.
We prefer the Link. But occasionally, it can be interesting to exist as something else -- a tree perhaps, or a cloud in the sky.
A cloud. How many of us are there?
So many questions, Odo.
I'm sorry. But there's so much that isn't clear to me yet.
If you Link with me, everything will be made clear.
You have to understand, the Link is very overwhelming for me. Right now, it's easier to talk.
But words are so clumsy, so imprecise.
Even so.
As you wish.
You've never told me your name.
What use would I have for a name?
To differentiate yourself from the others.
I don't. DEEP SPACE NINE: "Behind the Lines" - REV. 8/21/97 - ACT FOUR 49.
But... you are a separate being. Aren't you?
In a sense.
When you return to the Link, what'll happen to the entity I'm talking to right now?
The drop becomes the ocean...
And if you choose to take solid form again?
The ocean becomes the drop...
Then can you answer your own question? How many of us are there?
One... and many. It depends on how you look at it.
Very good. You are beginning to understand. But there's so much more you don't know. DEEP SPACE NINE: "Behind the Lines" - REV. 8/21/97 - ACT FOUR 50.
Tell me.
Words would be insufficient.
Link with me again... It's the only way I can give you the understanding that you seek...
I can't.
Why not?
I promised Kira.
She's a Solid. This has nothing to do with her. This is about you, Odo -- about what you want.
Am I early?
A little. I hope there's more than just fruit in that basket.
I needed a place to hide my tools. In case anybody asks, I'm making a delivery. DEEP SPACE NINE: "Behind the Lines" - REV. 8/21/97 - ACT FOUR 50A.
Right.
Here's your fruit! DEEP SPACE NINE: "Behind the Lines" - REV. 8/21/97 - ACT FOUR 51.
I didn't order any fruit.
Your brother sent this, didn't he?
Uh...
If he's trying to win me over, tell him it's not going to work.
Better yet, I'll tell him myself.
Odo should be on his way to his office by now. Remember, he's going to interrupt the sensor alarms at exactly eight hundred hours.
scene: 37   INT. A SECOND HABITAT RING CORRIDOR

quote: I'll be ready.
scene: 37   INT. A SECOND HABITAT RING CORRIDOR

quote: I'll contact you if there's a problem. Good luck with your delivery...
scene: 37   INT. A SECOND HABITAT RING CORRIDOR

quote: Computer, time.
Seven hundred hours, fifty eight minutes.
Two minutes to go...
Odo?
Kira to Odo.
Please respond. DEEP SPACE NINE: "Behind the Lines" - REV. 8/21/97 - ACT FOUR 51B.
Odo.
Computer, time.
Seven hundred hours, fifty nine minutes.
Hello, major.
Just the person I was looking for...
Better give him a few more seconds just to be sure...
-- congratulations on your promotion, but we'll have to discuss the personnel report some other time. DEEP SPACE NINE: "Behind the Lines" - REV. 8/21/97 - ACT FIVE 53.
We'll discuss it now.
I don't think so.
Kira to Rom -- don't open that hatch.
I already did.
Get out of there!
Intruder alert, come with me!
Well, well... what do we have here...
Captain's Log: Tactical update. The Defiant has returned to Starbase after its successful attack on the Dominion sensor array.
Admiral Ross and I have recommended that Lieutenant Commander Dax and the entire Defiant crew be cited for exceptional performance of their duties.
Admiral on deck!
Carry on.
Nog, Saurian Brandy for the brass!
She doesn't believe me.
Frankly, I'm not sure it really happened myself.
Sir. Sir.
Congratulations, captain.
Thank you, sir. Excuse me, I need to talk to Julian.
Sirs, here you are.
Don't ask him where he got it.
Don't worry, captain -- I don't want to know. DEEP SPACE NINE: "Behind the Lines" - REV. 8/21/97 - ACT FIVE 56.
Another one, Captain.
Take a good look. Because this says something about us.
It says that we're willing to fight -- and that we'll keep on fighting until we can't fight anymore.
Yes, sir! DEEP SPACE NINE: "Behind the Lines" - REV. 8/21/97 - ACT FIVE 57.
You don't throw something like this away.
No, sir!
They're a good crew.
The best.
What do you say we get back to work?
What the hell happened? Why didn't you disable the alarm?
It's difficult to explain...
Rom is sitting in a holding cell being interrogated! He was counting on you. I was counting on you.
I know.
You know! Do you realize you handed the Alpha Quadrant to the Dominion?
I was in the Link.
Are you telling me you forgot?
I didn't forget. It just... didn't seem to matter.
You know! A lot of people are going to die -- don't you care?
It has nothing to do with me.
How can you say that?
If you could experience the Link, you'd know why nothing else matters.
The last five years... your life here... our friendship -- none of that matters? DEEP SPACE NINE: "Behind the Lines" - REV. 8/21/97 - ACT FIVE 59.
It did... once.
I wish I could make you understand. But you can't. You're not a changeling.
That's right. I'm a Solid.
You look troubled, Odo. Did she upset you?
No... not really...
Hey, dad.
Jake-O.
Something smells good.
I'm making dinner for Kasidy.
I thought she was on a supply run.
She's getting back tonight.
Get away from there.
I just wanted a taste.
You can have the leftovers tomorrow.
You're not inviting me to join you for dinner?
I haven't seen Kas in over a week.
Neither have I.
And I'm sure she misses you. But not as much as she misses me.
What's this?
Nice spot, huh?
Bajor, right?
Kendra province. Just south of the Yolja river. I was there the other day.
I thought you went to some conference in Rakantha.
I did. But afterwards Vedek Oram invited me to see his Monastery in Adarak. We took a transport across the mountains.
The sun was just going down and the whole valley was shimmering in the light. I looked out the window and said to myself "This is the place. This is where I'm going to build my house."
Here we go again. You and your dream house.
You think this is just your old man's idle fantasy? What if I told you that as of this morning, all this land belongs to me?
You're serious?
Twelve hecapates. I'm going to start building as soon as the war's over. (smiling at the picture) I'll retire here someday... and watch the sun set over the mountains every night.
What?
I don't know... it's a little weird to hear you talk about retiring.
I said someday.
I guess Starfeet'll get a few more years out of you.
Once the war's over, I'll have a place to get away on weekends.
Get away? Do you know what's going to happen when the Bajorans realize the Emissary has a house in Kendra province? It'll become a shrine. People'll come from all over to see it. And you.
You're exaggerating. Again.
We'll see.
It's funny how thing's turn out. I remember when you first got this assignment -- you almost turned it down.
I know. I never thought I'd get so attached to Bajor. But more and more, it feels like home.
I can think of worse places to visit my old man...
You just make sure you bring my grandkids to see me a few times a year.
Grandkids?
Lots of 'em.
I bumped into Captain Boday the other night.
Captain Boday?
(not his favorite person) The Gallamite. Jadzia dated him.
Toothy smile? Transparent skull?
That's him.
What's he doing on the station?
The Gallamites are supplying duranium for the war effort.
I don't know what Jadzia ever saw in that man...
His brains, for one.
Did he know who you were?
Not at first.
But once he found out, I'm sure he laid on the charm.
You could say that.
The man's insufferable. He's opinionated. Arrogant.
Charming.
Something wrong?
We just got word from the Klingons. The Rotarran and the Koraga were ambushed by a Dominion patrol near the Badlands.
Worf was commanding the Koraga...
It didn't make it. The Rotarran recovered six escape pods... Worf wasn't aboard any of them.
Heard anything from the Defiant?
I talked to Benjamin this morning. He said that according to the Koraga's crew, Worf was the last to leave the bridge. No one knows if he made it to an escape pod.
My money says he did. We haven't seen the last of that crazy Klingon.
They've been searching for three days...
They'll find him. It's just going to take a while. You know what it's like in the Badlands, there's a lot of sensor interference.
I should've gone with them...
What would you be able to do that they can't?
Probably nothing, but it'd be easier than sitting here waiting.
He'll be back before you know it.
You really think so?
Absolutely. The night before he went on patrol, he brought the Koraga's crew in here and bought them three barrels of bloodwine.
And?
And he didn't pay the tab. You really think he'd go to Sto'Vo'Kor owing me money?
He doesn't even like you.
Exactly. He couldn't enjoy the afterlife knowing that I had something over him.
Thanks, Quark.
Ops to Lieutenant Dax.
Go ahead.
You have an incoming transmission from the Defiant.
Patch it through.
What is it, Benjamin?
I'm afraid we're going to have to call off the search.
You're giving up... ?
We don't have any choice. There are over a dozen Jem'Hadar ships closing on our position.
But what if he's out there somewhere?
Let's face it, the odds aren't good. We don't even know that he made it off the Koraga.
I'm sorry.
The Defiant is returning to Federation space. I'm ordering our ships to pursue.
No. Divert them to the So'na outpost on Devos Two.
Why?
We need them to help protect the new Ketracel White facility. The Federation has been made aware of its location.
Can't the So'na protect it?
Are you questioning my orders? That would be... foolish.
(still studying the starchart) I wonder what the Defiant was doing out there... ?
Probably looking for survivors from the Koraga.
For that long?
Our adversaries don't see their soldiers as expendable. They're not bred in hatcheries like the Jem'Hadar.
If you have something to say, Damar, say it.
Do you have any idea how many casualties Cardassia has taken? There's not a single family that hasn't lost someone in this war.
Their sacrifices won't be in vain. We will be victorious.
A bit early, isn't it? Even for you.
Just something to warm my bones. It's freezing in here.
The Founder prefers it that way.
I don't see why we should have to suffer. She hasn't been in here for days.
Feel free to dress warmly.
What does she do in her quarters all day? She didn't look well the last time I saw her. I hope she's not ill.
How could a god be ill?
Maybe she's not a god.
Whether you believe the Founders are gods or not is irrelevant. All they require from you is obedience.
Now. The Founder wants a subspace com-link installed in her quarters.
I'll see to it.
A secure channel -- separately encoded and isolated from the main communications array.
Why all the secrecy? Who's she going to be talking to?
That doesn't concern you...
No, of course not...
Computer, override locking mechanism. Authorization Dax nine- seven-four alpha-three.
Go. I will take care of Yoshi.
Worf, you're very sweet. But let's face it. You're not good with babies.
What does gung-gung-gung mean?
Why do you ask?
When I was taking Yoshi home, he kept shaking his rattle and saying "gung-gung-gung."
You must go to Sirella and beg her forgiveness.
I don't beg.
Jadzia, daughter of Kela, does your heart beat only for this man?
Yes.
And do you swear to join with him and stand with him against all who would oppose you?
I swear.
Do you swear to join with him and stand with him against all who would oppose you?
I swear.
Captain, we have a problem. It's Ezri. She's gone.
Gone?
There's a runabout missing.
She must've gotten it into her head to go looking for Worf.
What could she be thinking?
She's a Dax. Sometimes they don't think. They just do.
I'm not spacesick, I'm not spacesick, I'm not --
Uh-oh.
Sisko to Ganges.
Sisko to Ganges, respond.
Ganges, here.
Kshsh. I'm not reading you very well. There's -- kshsh -- interference.
Dax, turn that ship around and get back here.
(pretending she couldn't hear) What was that, Benjamin?
Cut it out, old man. I'm not buying it.
Kshshh.
I gave you an order, lieutenant.
Don't worry, sir. I'll find him.
We could send the Defiant to bring her back.
No. Let her go.
Captain?
Send her a copy of the Defiant's sensor logs. No sense in her searching the same area we did.
Aye, sir.
Do you think there's any chance she'll be able to find him?
I wish I could say yes.
Then why are you letting her do this?
Because she needs to. And because she'd never forgive me if I stopped her.
Computer, show me the position of the Koraga at the time it was attacked.
Which escape pods were recovered?
The six starboard pods were recovered.
Why none from the port side?
Unknown.
Assuming someone made it to the port escape pod closest to the bridge, calculate its trajectory.
Computer, take us to the coordinates where it would've entered the Badlands.
Acknowledged.
Computer, cut all engines.
Warning. Without maneuvering thrusters, the ship may be swept into areas of plasma-flare activity.
I know. But with any luck, the currents will take us to the same place they took Worf.
Cut the engines.
Ben... what are you doing up?
Couldn't sleep.
It's coming along...
I thought working on it might take my mind off things...
If Worf's out there, she'll find him.
So what do you think?
It's going to be beautiful.
These windows face south, toward the valley.
It'll be a nice view...
There's a stream running through the property. The soil's perfect for growing kava. I could make my own springwine.
The Emissary's Special Reserve. Should be a big seller.
I'm trying to decide whether I should open up this wall, or keep the kitchen separate.
Open it up. Who wants to be locked away cooking when you've got guests over?
A man needs to concentrate when he's in the kitchen. I don't want people coming in and sticking their fingers in my saucepans.
It's your house.
I want it to be our house.
Let's get married, Kas.
Do you mean it?
I love you.
Is that a yes?
What do you think?
If you're going to play hard to get...
What a beautiful ring...
Kasidy Yates, will you be my wife?
Yes, Mister Sisko. I believe I will.
Warning. Plasma-flare activity ahead.
You're not kidding...
Re-establishing engine control is recommended.
No, let's sit tight. Our only hope of finding that escape pod is to follow the currents. Transfer all available power to the shields.
Acknowledged.
Computer, hold position. Activate a tractor beam and lock on to that pod.
Worf...
Ezri... ?
You're hurt.
It is nothing.
Easy.
There we go...
You're alone?
The Defiant was forced to call off its search because of the Jem'Hadar.
Why would the captain risk sending a runabout to look for me?
He didn't. I came without his permission.
You're a fellow officer. I would've done the same for Kira or Julian.
Of course.
I will do it myself.
I'll... contact the station and tell them we're on our way back...
Founder, I'm honored to be summoned to your presence.
I trust the new communications system meets your needs?
It's adequate.
If I can be of any further assistance.
When the time comes. The vaccine -- how is it progressing?
I regret that it failed to stabilize the latest sample you provided.
I see.
I have a team of Vorta Doctors working night and day to find a cure.
Have them document their efforts. Then eliminate them.
Founder?
Activate their clones and order them to continue their predecessors' work. Perhaps a fresh perspective will speed matters along.
Of course.
The Cardassians -- what have you told them?
They know nothing.
Good. The sickness that has infected the Great Link is none of their concern. They may be our allies, but they're not to be trusted. We must not show weakness.
This unfortunate malady will soon be behind us. I won't rest until a cure is found.
See that you don't.
We'll require another sample.
Very well.
So you approve?
Approve? I'm the one who set you up with Kasidy in the first place.
That's right, you did.
Practically had to twist your arm. "A freighter captain? You want me to go out with a freighter captain?"
You've got to admit, the job description conjures up a certain image.
You shouldn't have doubted me. I knew the first time I met her she was the woman for you.
If you're going to take the credit, you're going to have to take on certain responsibilities.
Like what?
Like being my best man.
Are you serious?
Absolutely.
You sure you don't want to ask Grandpa or Dax?
I'm sure. So what do you say?
I'm honored.
Best man... That means I get to plan the bachelor party...
What are you doing?
Realigning the inertial stabilizers.
Didn't you just do that a few hours ago?
I want to make sure the systems are running at optimal efficiency.
Right.
So... What was it like being in that escape pod for so long?
Quiet.
What'd you do to pass the time?
Nothing.
Nothing?
I bet the acoustics in there were pretty good.
What'd you sing? Klingon opera?
I did not sing.
Which one? Shevok'tah gish?
(reluctantly admitting it) No. Gav'ot toh'va.
Ambitious. The solos are for a tenor.
As you said, the acoustics were favorable.
I remember the first time you played it for Jadzia...
Sorry.
There is no need to apologize. Though I would prefer that we not discuss her.
I understand.
What about Alexander?
What about him?
Is it all right if I ask how the "Son of Worf" is doing? I hear he was made weapons officer on the Ya'Vang.
They were shorthanded.
You make it sound like he didn't deserve it.
That was not my intention.
Aren't you ever going to ease up on him?
My relationship with Alexander is not your concern.
That's funny. Because on our wedding night you told me --
Sorry. I shouldn't have mentioned our wedding night -- I mean, Jadzia's wedding night.
This is ridiculous. We can't have a conversation if you refuse to talk about the things we have in common.
Perhaps we should not have a conversation.
You've been avoiding me for the past six months.
I did not ask you to come to the station.
I would have left, but you told me to stay!
And I'm beginning to regret it.
If it wasn't for me, you'd still be drifting around in an escape pod singing Klingon opera.
Sensors are detecting two ships closing on our position.
They're Jem'Hadar fighters.
I'm taking us out of warp.
Is that a good idea?
We can't outrun them. The Goralis System is nearby -- we may be able to lose them there.
They're coming in behind us.
Transfer auxiliary power to aft- shields.
Shields down to thirty percent.
I'm taking us into the atmosphere -- their ships are not designed for sub-orbital flight.
They're pulling away.
Glad to hear it, but that last hit took out our starboard thrusters.
We're losing altitude.
I can't compensate --
We must abandon ship.
Energize.
That was a good call...
We may be here several days. (pulling out a tricorder) I will reconnoiter the area. Set up a com-link and try to contact the station.
Right. Where's the com-unit?
Didn't you take one?
I thought you did.
No.
Look on the bright side... We'll have plenty of time to talk...
What do you say we ask Bill Ross to perform the ceremony?
My mother would prefer for her daughter to be married by a minister... But I guess an admiral's the next best thing.
I'll talk to him.
About the guest list. I want to keep it small -- just family and friends.
Fine by me. There's only room for about thirty or forty people in the wardroom anyway.
That just leaves the menu.
Any objections to Quark doing the catering?
Just make sure he doesn't overcharge us.
I'll see if I can... "cut a deal."
What else do we need to talk about? I get the feeling we're forgetting something.
You tell me. You're the one who's been married before.
That's just it. I remember it being a lot more complicated.
People always get carried away with weddings. I just want to keep things nice and simple.
Excuse me, Emissary.
Hello, Sahgi.
I wanted to congratulate you -- both of you.
Well, aren't you sweet. Who told you we were getting married?
Everybody's talking about it. Can I be one of your dais bearers?
My what, honey?
For the bridal procession. I know you can only choose fifty- one girls, but it would be such an honor for me.
Well, uh...
People are saying it's going to be the biggest wedding Bajor's ever seen.
Are they?
The Emissary's getting married.
(turning to Sisko for help) Ben...
Kas... I think this is going to be a little more complicated than we thought...
-- what I'd give to wipe the smirk off that little Vorta's face.
Still, power has its privileges. You're a good listener, my dear. If only my wife were as understanding.
What is it?
(clearly surprised to see him) Dukat...
Leave us.
Does Weyoun know you're here?
I see he still has you under his thumb.
My concern is for you. The last time you saw him, you made certain promises. Promises you weren't able to keep.
I may have failed to reopen the wormhole, but I assure you, I have no regrets.
You see... I've come to know the love of the Pah-wraiths.
You almost sound like you mean it.
I do. (off Damar's surprise) Tell me, Damar. What do you believe in? The Dominion?
I believe in Cardassia.
Good. Then we're still on the same side.
What brings you here?
I came to see you, old friend. I need your help.
I'm afraid you have an exaggerated sense of my importance. But I'll do what I can.
I knew you would.
Dinner.
Why'd you have to kill a defenseless animal -- we have plenty of field-rations.
I have been eating field-rations for six days. I am sick of field- rations.
So you just traipsed off into the jungle and phasered yourself something to eat.
I did not use a phaser. (holding up a homemade SPEAR) I used this.
I suppose that makes it "sporting?"
It took me hours to track this animal. And while doing so, I could have easily been attacked by a predator myself.
Spare me the "one with nature" speech.
I killed it. And now I'm going to eat it. If you don't want any, then have some more field- rations.
Fine.
(grumbling to himself) Jadzia would have understood...
I thought we weren't supposed to talk about her.
